meanings.definition: To set or place heavily or abruptly
meanings.sent1: She plonks the book on the table.
meanings.sent2: He always plonks his bag on the floor when he comes home.
meanings.sent3: The cat plonks itself on the warm spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: The rain plonks down on the roof like tiny drums.
meanings.sent5: The hammer plonks the nail into the wood with a loud thud.

meanings.sent1: The plonks of the hammer echoed in the empty room.
meanings.sent2: The plonks of the falling rocks could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent3: The plonks of the old piano keys made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The plonks of the raindrops on the tin roof created a soothing rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The plonks of the heavy footsteps signaled his arrival.

meanings.definition: To drop or place something heavily or carelessly
meanings.sent1: He plonks the groceries on the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent2: She plonks herself on the couch after a long day.
meanings.sent3: The tired toddler plonks the toy back in the box.
meanings.sent4: The chef plonks a dollop of cream on top of the dessert.
meanings.sent5: The worker plonks the heavy toolbox on the ground with a sigh.
